abstract: Major League Baseball’s 2008 All-Star Game, which lasted 15 innings, led Tuesday night’s television ratings by a wide margin.
snippet: Major League Baseball’s 2008 All-Star Game, which lasted 15 innings, led Tuesday night’s television ratings by a wide margin.
lead_paragraph: Major League Baseball’s 2008 All-Star Game, which lasted 15 innings, led Tuesday night’s television ratings by a wide margin. Although the game didn’t end until 1:37 a.m. Eastern, Nielsen’s time-zone-adjusted estimates show the first three hours of Fox’s live broadcast, which began at 8:42 p.m., drew an average of 14.5 million viewers, 2 million more than a year ago and its best result in six years.

headline.main: The All-Star Game Tops the Ratings
